0.title: What is National Logistics Policy, launched by PM to reduce logistics cost?
0.article_body: PM Narendra Modi unveiled the National Logistics Policy, which aims to bring down the high cost of logistics in the country. The policy will ensure quick last-mile delivery, end transport-related challenges, save time and money of manufacturers, and prevent wastage of agro-products. Further, the Unified Logistics Interface Platform will bring all transportation services to a single-window portal.

1.title: BMC to construct two bridges in Mumbai's Chembur
1.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to construct two bridges in Mumbai's Chembur area near the Anik Panjrapol connector road. Both the bridges will be built at a cost of around ₹58 crore. According to the proposal, the south-bound bridge would be 50 metres long while the north-bound bridge would be 100 metres.

2.title: Amit Shah distributes equipment to specially-abled people in Hyd
2.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah distributed various equipment to specially-abled people and cleaning machines to government schools and community hostels in Hyderabad to mark PM Narendra Modi's birthday on Saturday. "PM Modi urges that every person should involve themselves in work of service...so that crores of poor, downtrodden, backward and needy persons...get help," he said.

3.title: Women remove hijabs to protest against 22-yr-old woman's death in Iran
3.article_body: Several women in Iran took off their hijabs to mark their protest against the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini following her detention by 'morality police' in Iran. A video of the protest has surfaced online, showing the women cheering and raising slogans after removing their hijabs. A huge crowd gathered at a cemetery, chanting "death to dictator" slogan.

4.title: At least 126 cattle dead due to lumpy skin disease in Maharashtra
4.article_body: The Maharashtra animal husbandry department confirmed that at least 126 cattle have died after being infected by the lumpy virus. "Lumpy skin disease has been rapidly spreading all throughout the Maharashtra state. It is a cutaneous viral disease of the bovines. This disease is not transmitted to human beings either from animals or through cow milk," said the department.

5.title: All rumours of objectionable videos of girls are false: Chandigarh University
5.article_body: Chandigarh University has issued a statement after protests over alleged leaked videos of girl students, saying, "All the rumours of objectionable videos shot of other girl students are totally false and baseless." It added, "No videos were found of any student which are objectionable except a personal video shot by a girl which was shared by her with her boyfriend."

6.title: High-level inquiry ordered, will take strict action: Mann on Chandigarh University videos
6.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has ordered a high-level inquiry in the Chandigarh University videos case. Taking to Twitter, Mann said, "Sad to hear about an incident at Chandigarh University. Our daughters are our pride. Have ordered a high-level inquiry into the incident." "[We] will take strict action...I appeal to all of you to avoid rumours," he added.

7.title: Elon Musk responds after Russia warns against military use of civilian satellites
7.article_body: After a Russian official said civilian satellites “may become a legitimate target for retaliation” if used for military purposes, SpaceX CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "Starlink is meant for peaceful use only." While the official didn't mention SpaceX, he said this "extremely dangerous trend" has become apparent in Ukraine. Notably, SpaceX provided Starlink terminals to Ukraine after Russian invasion.

8.title: Mentality of North India, Parliament not conducive for women's quota: Pawar
8.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Saturday said the "mentality" of North India and the Parliament seems not conducive yet to giving reservation to women in Legislative Assemblies and Lok Sabha. "When I was CM of Maharashtra, reservation for women in local bodies like ZP and Panchayat Samiti was introduced. It was opposed initially but later people accepted it," he added.

9.title: At least I got it, many gifted actors did not: Gajraj on opportunity after 50
9.article_body: Actor Gajraj Rao said he feels no negativity that he got an opportunity like 'Bahaai Ho' after turning 50. "At least I got it. There are so many gifted actors who didn't," he said, adding, "There are countless actors who could have played part of Jitendra Kaushik in 'Badhaai Ho' very well...but I was very fortunate...that Amit Sharma chose me."

10.title: Won't recognise illegally appointed Varghese as St Stephen's principal: DU
10.article_body: The University of Delhi has written to the governing body of St Stephen's college, stating that it will not recognise Professor John Varghese as the college's principal since his five-year term ended. The University has asked the college to follow UGC regulations. "Not following the said provisions amounts to an illegal and non-statutory continuation of...Varghese as Principal," the letter stated.

11.title: Hundreds join drive to clean Philippines' Manila Bay; pics surface
11.article_body: Hundreds of volunteers joined a drive to clean the polluted Manila Bay in the Philippines to mark International Coastal Cleanup Day on Saturday. Pictures of the drive have surfaced online. "This initiative will help make our coastal area in Manila Bay better so that our tourists and visitors will see the beauty of the bay," a college student told Reuters.

12.title: Crude bomb explodes on school roof in West Bengal, students evacuated
12.article_body: A crude bomb exploded on the roof of a three-storied boys' school building in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas district on Saturday when classes were in progress. There was no casualty as students and teachers were in rooms on the first two floors of the building, police said. Students were evacuated while teachers found bomb splinters close to the roof.

13.title: Chin up, everything will change soon: Richa Chadha on boycott trend
13.article_body: Commenting on the boycott trend against Bollywood, Richa Chadha said the film industry needs to reimagine and transform, which she believes will happen soon. "Chin up, head up and may the force be with us all," she wrote on Instagram. Apologising to fans for being away from social media, Richa said she's been busy with shoots and some personal preparations.

14.title: Technology is not just for elite: SC judge on paperless courts
14.article_body: Supreme Court judge Justice DY Chandrachud said digitisation of courts will assist in crisis-proofing our justice delivery system. Speaking at inauguration of ‘Paperless District Courts in Odisha’ project, he said, "Technology is not just for the elite, it is for all those whom the delivery of justice is intended. Paperless courts will also save precious time for lawyers."

15.title: Japan issues landslide warning as Typhoon Nanmadol approaches Kyushu
15.article_body: Typhoon Nanmadol moved towards Japan's southernmost main island Kyushu on Sunday. The Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) has warned of high waves "like never experienced before" along with landslides and overflowing rivers. The US Navy's Joint Typhoon Warning Center has classified the 14th typhoon of the season as a super typhoon, the JMA said. Railway operators cancelled trains in the region.

16.title: Vendor urinates on vegetables before selling them in UP, arrested after video goes viral
16.article_body: A vegetable vendor identified as Sharif Khan was arrested after a video showing him urinating on vegetables on his cart before going to sell them in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly went viral on social media. The man was reportedly beaten up by locals before being arrested. Bareilly Police have stated that an FIR has been registered at Prem Nagar Police Station.

17.title: Only 1 video of accused girl found: Police on 'leaked videos of 60 Chandigarh University girls'
17.article_body: After protests erupted in Chandigarh University over reported leak of videos of around 60 girls taking baths, Mohali SSP Vivek Soni said, "So far in our investigation, we've found only one video of the accused herself." He added there is no other video of anyone and the accused girl has also not claimed of recording any video of other girls.

18.title: Hebbal Durga Puja celebrations to begin on October 1 in Bengaluru
18.article_body: The iconic Hebbal Durga Puja celebrations are going to begin on October 1 this year in Bengaluru. This year's theme is titled "Phire Dekho Kolkata" and it will capture the unforgettable images of Kolkata's Durga Puja celebrations over the years. The organisers said that this time the decorations are deeply inspired by the iconic Jorasanko Thakurbari.

19.title: Couple hacked Holiday Inn-owner IHG's tech systems via a weak password 'for fun'
19.article_body: A couple from Vietnam, who allegedly hacked the technical systems of Holiday Inn owner InterContinental Hotels Group, said they did it "for fun". The couple said that they first tried a ransomware attack and then deleted large amounts of data after they were foiled. While they claimed that they accessed IHG's databases via a weak password, Qwerty1234, IHG refuted this.

20.title: After ‘Chandni Bar’, people assumed I love dark cinema: Bhandarkar
20.article_body: Director Madhur Bhandarkar said people assumed that he loves to make dark cinema after the release of 'Chandni Bar' (2001), but when he got 'Babli Bouncer', he wanted to make a comedy film. "After the first pandemic hit us so badly, I felt we really need a comedy film that people can watch with their family," Bhandarkar said.

21.title: Delhi CM Kejriwal condemns Chandigarh University video leak incident
21.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has condemned the Chandigarh University video leak incident calling it very serious and shameful. He also assured the students that all culprits will get the harshest punishment. "We are with you. All must act with patience," Kejriwal tweeted. Students of the university staged a massive protest all night after the incident came to light.

22.title: Ashok Gehlot passes resolution to appoint Rahul Gandhi as Congress President
22.article_body: Ahead of the Congress Presidential election, Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Saturday passed a resolution to appoint Rahul Gandhi as Congress chief again. "Whatever the National President (Sonia Gandhi) decides would be accepted, including the appointment of state chiefs," said Rajasthan minister PS Khachariyawas. The polls for the crucial post will be held on October 17.

23.title: Levi's announces new season of collaboration with Deepika Padukone
23.article_body: Levi's has launched the third season of its collaboration with Deepika Padukone. Inspired by her ease in making relaxed, oversized pieces look effortlessly stylish, the collection is a creative re-imagination of what is authentically Levi’s®, it said, adding that it fused exaggerated proportions of the 90s with a modern-day streetwear vibe through its range of fits, co-ord sets & more.

24.title: NIA conducts raids at several places in Andhra Pradesh & Telangana in PFI case
24.article_body: The National Investigation Agency, on Sunday, conducted raids at several locations in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana in connection with the PFI case. Raids were conducted in Nellore, Kurnool, Kadapa and Guntur of Andhra Pradesh and in Nizamabad and Jagtial in Telangana. The probe agency also searched the residence of Shadulla who is the main accused in the case.

25.title: Grew up listening to stories on anti-Sikh riots: Diljit Dosanjh
25.article_body: Singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh said he "grew up listening" to stories on the anti-Sikh riots. The actor said his film 'Jogi', which revolves around the 1984 massacre, is an amalgamation of all such stories. "The story is real," Diljit said, adding, "People who have seen or heard, they can relate, and the newer generation will know what had happened".

26.title: Taunting person for handicap most inhumane cruelty: Punjab & Haryana HC
26.article_body: The Punjab and Haryana High Court has observed taunting a person for their handicap constitutes the most inhumane kind of cruelty to any disabled person. The court made this observation while granting divorce to a polio-afflicted man. His plea for divorce on the grounds of cruelty and desertion was dismissed by a trial court which he had challenged in HC.

27.title: India reports 5,664 new COVID-19 cases, daily positivity rate now at 1.96%
27.article_body: India reported 5,664 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country recorded 5,747 fresh COVID-19 cases. Meanwhile, 4,555 recoveries were recorded across India in the last 24 hours. The active cases in the country now stand at 47,922. The daily positivity rate currently stands at 1.96%.

28.title: William, Harry stand vigil at Queen's coffin along with cousins
28.article_body: Prince William and Prince Harry stood vigil along with Queen Elizabeth II's six other grandchildren at her coffin for 15 minutes on Saturday. A video of the vigil shows both the brothers standing on either side of the coffin, wearing military uniforms. Earlier, King Charles III authorised Prince Harry to wear the uniform after he was banned from doing so.

29.title: Talking about a few subjects: Sunny on teaming up with Rajkumar Santoshi
29.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol said he and director Rajkumar Santoshi are waiting to collaborate on a film and "discover something new". The actor-director duo has previously worked on films like 'Ghayal', 'Ghatak' and 'Damini'. Stating that they often meet each other, Sunny informed, "There are a couple of subjects we are talking about at the moment, so let's hope they materialise."

30.title: Starbucks customers' data accessed in online breach in Singapore
30.article_body: Starbucks Singapore said on Friday that its customer database was breached online in which information of 2,00,000 people was reportedly stolen. In an e-mail to customers seen by AFP, Starbucks Singapore said it had discovered unauthorised access to details like names, gender and phone numbers. The stolen data was put on sale in an online forum, The Straits Times reported.

31.title: Kanpur residents ask UP CM to demolish apartments over inferior quality
31.article_body: Residents of Kanpur's KDA Residency staged a protest on Saturday over the inferior quality of the apartments. They posted banners outside the society urging Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath to demolish the apartments. A resident said in an interview, "Apartments weren't made of the quality that was promised to us. Inferior construction material was used. The building has deteriorated."

32.title: Who is Gautam Adani's eldest son Karan, who has been named Chairman of ACC?
32.article_body: Karan Adani, the eldest son of the world's second richest person Gautam Adani, has been appointed as the Chairman of cement producer ACC following its acquisition by Adani Group. The 35-year-old graduated with a bachelor's degree in economics from Purdue University, USA, in 2009. Karan has been overseeing Adani Ports and Special Economic Zones (APSEZ) as its CEO since 2016.

33.title: Dalit student beaten by teacher over complain on faulty computers in UP
33.article_body: A Dalit student was beaten by his teacher and left with a fractured hand after complaining about non-functional computers in a UP school. The incident occurred on Tuesday when Principal Secretary and District Magistrate visited Deendayal Upadhyaya Ashram Paddhati Vidyalaya in Chandauli for inspection. The officials reprimanded the teacher who felt humiliated and vented his anger on the student.

34.title: Pelosi-led US delegation arrives in Armenia days after clashes with Azerbaijan
34.article_body: US congressional delegation led by House Speaker Nancy Pelosi arrived in Armenia on Saturday. The trip comes days after clashes broke out between Armenia and Azerbaijan in which more than 200 troops were killed. The US Embassy said the trip will include meeting with Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan. "The trip is all about human rights," Pelosi said in Berlin.

35.title: Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway where Cyrus Mistry died, claimed over 60 lives this year
35.article_body: The 100-km stretch of the Mumbai-Ahmedabad highway between Ghodbunder in Thane and Dapchari in Palghar district witnessed 262 accidents this year, claiming at least 62 lives and leaving 192 persons injured, said police officials. The Charoti stretch, where former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was killed in a road accident, has seen 26 deaths since the start of this year.

36.title: I am very dependent on Alia Bhatt: Ranbir Kapoor
36.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said he is very dependent on his wife and actress Alia Bhatt. "I don't go to the bathroom or eat food without knowing where she is. It is very important for me that Alia stays near me," he said. Alia added that while they are good individually, they are better together.

37.title: Right decision: Ukrainian Prez on Nike leaving Russian market
37.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that he spoke to representatives of the sportswear brand Nike and thanked them for the company's decision to leave the Russian market, calling it the "right decision". "If a state chooses the path of terror, it is the duty of every self-respecting company to distance itself from such a state," he added.

38.title: Blake Lively criticises paparazzi waiting outside her house; shares pregnancy pics for them
38.article_body: Hollywood actress Blake Lively, who's expecting her fourth child with actor Ryan Reynolds, has criticised the paparazzi waiting outside her house. "Here are photos of me pregnant in real life so the 11 guys waiting outside my home...will leave me alone. You freak me and my kids out...thank you to the media who have a 'No Kids Policy'," she wrote.

39.title: No deaths or attempt to suicide reported: Police on leaked videos of Chandigarh University girls
39.article_body: After students of Chandigarh University protesting over the reported leak of videos of girl students bathing in the hostel alleged loss of life and injuries, Mohali SSP Vivek Soni said, "No suicide attempt or death has taken place." "One student who was taken in an ambulance was suffering from anxiety and our team is in contact with her," he added.

40.title: Over 1 lakh people donated blood on PM's birthday: Health Minister
40.article_body: Over one lakh volunteers donated blood under the 'Raktdaan Amrit Mahotsav' that was flagged off on the occasion of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 72nd birthday, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said. Taking to Twitter, the Health Minister wrote, "A new world record was created on the very first day with over 87,000 people voluntarily donating in a single day."

41.title: Manoj Bajpayee meets Lalu Prasad in Patna, Bihar Deputy CM shares pics
41.article_body: Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav on Saturday shared pictures of actor Manoj Bajpayee meeting RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav in Patna. Tejashwi wrote alongside the pictures in Hindi, "Son of Bihar's soil, a well-known actor of Hindi cinema, Padma Shri @BajpayeeManoj ji reached the residence and got information about the health condition of father Shri @laluprasadrjd ji."

42.title: Australia won't ban Russian tourists: Australian Defence Minister
42.article_body: Australian Defence Minister Richard Marles has said that the country will not ban Russian tourists as part of sanctions imposed on Russia amid the Ukraine war. He said that the sanctions were aimed at the Russian government and "not the Russian people themselves". "Our objective is to empower Ukraine itself...this needs to be resolved on their terms," he further said.

43.title: Vedanta-Foxconn was ready to sign MoU, minister was busy with politics: Aaditya
43.article_body: Vedanta-Foxconn was ready to sign the MoU with the Maharashtra government but the industries minister was busy doing politics, Shiv Sena's Aaditya Thackeray said. "There was a meeting between Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis and Vedanta on August 29 and on September 5, a letter was written to Vedanta asking for time for MoU," The Print quoted Thackeray as saying.

44.title: 109 killed in 341 crashes across 48 Mumbai blackspots between 2019-21: Data
44.article_body: Data released by the Maharashtra Highway Traffic Police said that 109 people were killed in 341 crashes across 48 blackspots in Mumbai between 2019 and 2021. Mumbai is, according to the data, on top of 44 districts studied by the department. Navi Mumbai has come second with 32 blackspots, followed by Nagpur with 23.

45.title: 3 held for illegal possession of deadly weapons: Rachakonda Police
45.article_body: Rachakonda Police on Saturday tweeted that three persons were arrested by the Special Operations Team (LB Nagar) for the alleged illegal possession of deadly weapons and three daggers were seized from them. All three accused, aged between 29 and 36, are residents of Shaheen Nagar. The police said that the trio was using weapons to threaten the public.

46.title: Video shows hundreds of girls protesting at Chandigarh University after bathing videos leak
46.article_body: A video showing hundreds of girls protesting at Chandigarh University and chanting 'we want justice' has surfaced online. The protest broke out at night after videos of around 60 girls taking baths in the hostel were leaked online. Meanwhile, police and the university administration have dismissed claims that multiple students attempted suicide as a result of the incident.

47.title: Techies from Google, Meta paying up to $150,000 on leg-lengthening surgeries: US doctor
47.article_body: A US-based cosmetic surgeon revealed that employees of many technology companies and CEOs are opting for leg-lengthening procedures which cost between $70,000 and $150,000. In an interview, the doctor said that his clients include workers from Google, Microsoft, Amazon and Meta and that most of them are men. The doctor also said that his business boomed during the pandemic.

48.title: Guilty won't be spared: Punjab minister on leaked videos of Chandigarh University girls
48.article_body: After protests erupted in Chandigarh University over leaked videos of 60 girls taking baths in the hostel, Punjab Minister of School Education Harjot Singh Bains said, "No one guilty will be spared." He tweeted, "I humbly request all the students of Chandigarh University to remain calm. It's a very sensitive matter and relates to dignity of our sisters and daughters."

49.title: AAP has become curse for Delhi and country: BJP after Amanatullah's arrest
49.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta criticised the AAP government after MLA Amanatullah Khan was arrested in connection with the Waqf Board corruption case and said that the party has become a curse for Delhi and the country. "Our protest against corruption in the Delhi government will continue and we will take the issue to the people," said Gupta.

50.title: Actual cinegoers don't look at reviews: Sunny Deol on negative film reviews
50.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol in an interview has stated that actual cinegoers don't look at negative reviews by critics. "He sees the trailer and wants to go to the cinema hall and come out for that intoxication...and it can be gauged from the trailer," he added. The actor further said that critics are doing their job when writing film reviews.

51.title: Ali Asgar's daughter says she & brother were trolled, called 'dadi ki beti'
51.article_body: Comedian Ali Asgar's daughter has revealed she and her brother were teased by their classmates who called them 'dadi ka beta' and 'dadi ki beti'. "He...[makes] fun of himself to make others laugh. That's not everyone's cup of tea," she added. Ali played Dadi in 'Comedy Nights With Kapil', Nani in 'The Kapil Sharma Show' and Basanti in 'Comedy Circus'.

52.title: Govt warns against 'SOVA' Android malware targeting Indian banking users
52.article_body: The government's CERT-In has issued a warning against 'SOVA' Android Trojan, a new type of malware campaign targeting Indian banking customers through more than 200 mobile apps. The malware hides itself within fake Android apps posing as famous and legitimate ones to deceive users. It captures users' credentials when they log into their netbanking apps and access their bank accounts.

53.title: Man of his calibre saying so gives me credit: Jackie on Anil saying he was insecure
53.article_body: Reacting to actor Anil Kapoor's remark saying he felt insecure of his success, actor Jackie Shroff has stated that a man of the former's calibre saying so gives him a lot of credit. "It is normal to look up to your older brother...What he says is such a beautiful emotional display which not many people say it," the actor added.

54.title: No plans to bring back vehicle towing policy in Bengaluru: State Home Minister
54.article_body: Reacting to the suspension of the vehicle towing policy from no-parking zones in Bengaluru, Home Minister Araga Jnanendra claimed that there are no plans to bring back the policy. He said that the department would hold a detailed discussion and obtain expert advice to implement a public-friendly and smooth vehicle parking system in the city.

55.title: UK PM preparing to scrap sugar tax on soft drinks: Report
55.article_body: British PM Liz Truss is reportedly preparing to scrap the sugar tax on soft drinks to ease the country's cost-of-living crisis. A ban on "buy one, get one free" promotions on unhealthy food, which was delayed by the British government earlier, was now unlikely to proceed. Earlier, Truss had said,"(People) don't want the government telling them what to eat."

56.title: World War II vintage bomb detonated safely along Indo-Myanmar border
56.article_body: Security forces on Saturday safely detonated a World War II vintage bomb in eastern Manipur along the Indo-Myanmar border. The bomb was recovered by locals during digging work in Kamjong district. Security forces along with local police shifted the bomb away from populated area and army bomb unit carried out the disposal of 250 lbs bomb using the 'Violent Technique'.

57.title: China reports 1st imported case of monkeypox in city of Chongqing
57.article_body: Mainland China has reported its first case of monkeypox in the city of Chongqing. An individual who arrived in Chongqing from overseas showed symptoms like skin rash during COVID quarantine period, reports said. All close contacts of the traveller have been isolated and put under medical observation. Monkeypox transmits through close contact with infected people or contaminated materials.

58.title: Need to rethink collegium system of appointment: Union Minister
58.article_body: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju on Saturday said there is a need to rethink the collegium system to expedite the process of appointment in higher judiciary as there are concerns about existing process. "System which is in place is causing trouble...everyone knows it…I put my views in front of everyone where judges, law officers...were there," Rijiju added during an event.

59.title: Labourer killed after argument over sharing work in Delhi's Azadpur market
59.article_body: A 31-year-old labourer was shot dead a few days after he had got into an argument with another man over sharing of work in Delhi's Azadpur market. The accused decided to take revenge while he was in an inebriated condition on Friday. Police said that a country-made pistol and two live cartridges were recovered from the possession of the accused.

60.title: I'm not on the run: Terra Co-founder after police say he's not in S'pore
60.article_body: Terraform Labs Co-founder Do Kwon has said he is not "on the run" after police said he was no longer in Singapore. This comes after an arrest warrant was issued against Kwon in South Korea. Kwon added he doesn't have anything to hide and is in "full cooperation" with agencies. Singapore police had said they would assist the Korean police.

61.title: Mumbai local train services to be affected on Central and Trans Harbour lines
61.article_body: The Mumbai local train services will be affected on the Central and the Trans Harbour lines today as the Central Railway for the Mumbai division will operate a mega block to carry out maintenance work on the tracks. There will be a five-hour block between Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) and Vidyavihar from 10:48 am to 3:49 pm.

62.title: Leaked videos of 60 Chandigarh University girls taking baths trigger protest; 1 arrested
62.article_body: A massive protest broke out at the Chandigarh University last night after videos of around 60 girls taking baths in the hostel were leaked online. Police arrested a girl student who allegedly made those videos and sent them to a boy in Shimla. A case has been registered against the accused girl under Sections 354c of IPC and IT Act.

63.title: Legal aid work is neglected in country, says CJI Lalit
63.article_body: Legal aid work is neglected in the country, CJI UU Lalit said while adding that young law graduates should devote as much time and energy as possible to provide legal aid services. "I've been associated with legal aid work...I don't mean to complain or show disrespect but legal aid in this country is neglected," he added during a convocation ceremony.

64.title: Ajay shares his & Kajol's similar smoking scenes, says 'She beat me to it'
64.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn took to Instagram to share similar smoking scenes from his and actress Kajol's past movies. In both the scenes, they're both respectively told that smoking isn't allowed in the area, to which both reply, asking if the cigarette is lit. "Arey, Kajol beat me to it," Ajay wrote on Instagram.

65.title: Thane woman jumps from building with 6-year-old daughter, both die
65.article_body: A 28-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide by jumping off the sixth floor of a building with her six-year-old daughter in Thane's Mira Road, police said. Both the deceased's bodies were found by the building's residents around 3.30 pm. No suicide note has been found, police added. A case of accidental death has been filed and a probe is underway.

66.title: 3 try to smuggle ₹93.3 lakh-gold at Hyd airport in separate incidents
66.article_body: Three people were arrested for allegedly attempting to smuggle gold at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in separate incidents and gold worth ₹93.3 lakh was recovered. In one incident, gold in spray form, which was hidden by spraying on undergarments, and in chain form were seized from two accused. The third accused tried to hide the gold in a briefcase.

67.title: World's most-followed TikToker Khaby Lame earns up to ₹6 crore per post
67.article_body: The manager of the world's most-followed creator on TikTok, Khaby Lame, revealed that the latter earns up to $750,000 (around ₹6 crore) per post. The 22-year-old’s manager said that Lame is on his way to earning $10 million this year. Lame joined TikTok in 2020 after losing his job as a factory machine worker due to the pandemic.

68.title: Meta asks staff to share desks, reserve seats before coming to office: Report
68.article_body: Meta has reportedly introduced a new desk sharing policy for its employees under which most of them will not have their own place in the office. Employees will instead be asked to reserve desks before they come to office, The Independent reported. Employees allegedly criticised the new policy and suggested that they would end up coming into the office less.

69.title: President Murmu arrives in London to attend Queen Elizabeth II's funeral, pics surface
69.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu has arrived in London to attend the state funeral of Queen Elizabeth II and offer condolences on behalf of the Indian government. Queen Elizabeth II passed away on September 8 at the age of 96 at the Balmoral Castle in Scotland. Her funeral will take place on September 19 at Westminster Abbey in London.

70.title: Delhi likely to get 35,000 seat, 51-acre stadium costing ₹350 crore in 3 yrs
70.article_body: Delhi is likely to get a 51-acre sports facility in three years. Reports said that the sports arena will have a seating capacity of 35,000 and will be made at a cost of an estimated ₹350 crore. The facility will come up in sector 19B of Dwarka and would include sports facilities like swimming, tennis and table tennis.

71.title: Pak reporter asks why women footballers can't wear leggings instead of shorts, criticised
71.article_body: Objecting to his country's women footballers wearing shorts, a Pakistani journalist, during a press conference, asked, “We belong to...Islamic Republic of Pakistan...I want to ask why are these girls wearing shorts, not leggings?" The team's head coach Adeel Rizki said in sports "one has to be progressive". Several social media users criticised the reporter, saying he has "regressive mindset".

72.title: AAP presents 6-month performance card of Punjab govt
72.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) presented a performance card of its six-month-old government in Punjab on Saturday, as it accused previous state governments of corruption. AAP leader Malvinder Kang said the government had so far given 20,000 jobs and regularised services of around 9,000 contractual employees. He added 300 units of free electricity and farming incentives were also given.

73.title: Jan Shatabdi Express derails in Odisha, no casualty reported
73.article_body: The Howrah-Bhubaneswar Jan Shatabdi Express derailed in Bhadrak, Odisha on Saturday, an official said, adding no casualty was reported. The two front wheels close to the engine derailed after the brakes were applied suddenly as there was a bull in front, he said. “It will take around 30 minutes to an hour to resume the train’s journey," the official said.

74.title: S Jaishankar to visit US from September 18-28, set to address UNGA
74.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will be on an official visit to the US during September 18-28. During the visit, he will lead India's delegation at the 77th Session of the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA), called High-Level Week. The week is themed 'A Watershed Moment: Transformative Solutions to Interlocking Challenges'. Jaishankar will address the UNGA on September 24.

75.title: Dharmendra Pradhan adopts TB patients from 4 districts of Odisha
75.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Saturday adopted all TB (tuberculosis) patients from Angul, Deogarh, Dhenkanal and Sambalpur districts of Odisha under the 'Pradhan Mantri TB Mukt Bharat Abhiyaan'. The minister said that he has adopted the patients to help realise PM Narendra Modi's goal of a TB-free India by 2025 as well as to mark the latter's 72nd birthday.

76.title: Thousands of Gujarat govt workers join 'mass casual leave' protest
76.article_body: Thousands of Gujarat government employees, including school teachers, have reportedly joined a 'mass casual leave' protest demanding Old Pension Scheme (OPS) implementation. Union body members said nearly 7,000 employees in Bhavnagar and 8,000 in Kutch did not go to work on Saturday. The state had announced on Friday that those who joined before April 2005 would get the OPS benefit.

77.title: Ricciardo's form isn't great: Haas F1 boss rules out signing driver
77.article_body: Haas F1 boss Guenther Steiner said he feels Daniel Ricciardo's "form isn't great" at the moment, thus putting him out of contention for a 2023 seat with the team. "We don't know what he's up to. Maybe he'll sit out a year," said Steiner. He added that he wants to take the least possible risk when picking his next driver.

78.title: Cheetahs arrived but why haven't jobs?: Rahul Gandhi to PM Modi
78.article_body: Addressing PM Modi, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi tweeted, "Eight cheetahs have come...Why didn't 16 crore jobs come in eight years?" The Congress had decided to observe September 17, which is PM Modi's birthday, as 'National Unemployment Day'. Rahul, during the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', said India was facing its 'worst-ever unemployment because of politics of hate'.

79.title: Prince William sends message of support to Aston Villa while in mourning
79.article_body: Aston Villa manager Steven Gerrard revealed that Prince William sent a message of support to the team while he mourns the death of his grandmother, Queen Elizabeth II. "It was along the lines of - would love to be there. He is consistently in touch," said Gerrard. William, a life-long Villa fan, is preparing for his grandmother's funeral on Monday.

80.title: 3 more people arrested in Mundra Port drugs case
80.article_body: Three more people, including an Afghanistan native, have been arrested in the September 2021 Mundra Port drugs case in which 3,000 kg of heroin was reportedly seized. After the arrests, the NIA claimed the drug network was operated by the Daad brothers from Afghanistan. The agency said the network transported five drug consignments from November 2020 to September 2021.

81.title: Karnataka logs 476 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1 death
81.article_body: Karnataka on Saturday reported 476 new cases of COVID-19 and one death due to the infection, the state health department said.  Of the fresh cases, as many as 215 were logged in Bengaluru Urban district. The lone fatality was recorded in Shivamogga, PTI reported. Active cases in the state stood at 3,735, as per the daily COVID-19 bulletin.

82.title: Umesh Yadav undergoing rehab at National Cricket Academy: Report
82.article_body: Indian pacer Umesh Yadav is reportedly rehabilitating at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru after suffering a thigh muscle injury while playing for English county side Middlesex last month. "Yadav's injury was sustained whilst playing in Middlesex's last home Royal London Cup match of the season against Gloucestershire at Radlett (on August 21)," the county cricket club said.

83.title: Dinesh Karthik has shown no interest in batting in the top 5: Gautam Gambhir
83.article_body: Former India captain Gautam Gambhir said there is no way both Rishabh Pant and Dinesh Karthik can play in the same XI during the T20 World Cup. "If you do that, you will miss out on a sixth bowler...Karthik, unfortunately, has shown no interest in batting in the top-5," said Gambhir. He added that Pant can be a match-winner.

84.title: Germany footballer Reus doubtful for World Cup after injuring ankle
84.article_body: Germany footballer Marco Reus, who missed the FIFA World Cup 2014 and Euro 2016 due to injury, is doubtful for FIFA World Cup 2022 after being stretchered off in first half of Dortmund's match against Schalke. Reus was in tears after bending his right ankle unnaturally while challenging for the ball. The extent of the injury hasn't been announced yet.

85.title: Sreesanth shares pics after India Maharajas' win, says 'Never ever give up on your dreams'
85.article_body: Sreesanth took to Instagram to share pictures after India Maharajas defeated World Giants in a special T20 match to mark India's 75 years of independence. "Just want to say...never ever give up on your dreams...just keep at it and for sure...there are many great hearts in the beautiful world to help you out," he wrote.

86.title: SRK's stunt double recalls working with actor in Brahmastra, calls him 'legend'
86.article_body: Hasit Savani, who was Shah Rukh Khan's stunt double in 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva', took to Instagram to share a picture of him posing with the actor on the sets of the film. "A real pleasure to be the stunt double for the legend...for his cameo sequence," he captioned the post. Shah Rukh played scientist Mohan Bhargav in the film.

87.title: Main line linking Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant to power grid restored
87.article_body: One of the four main lines supplying power from Ukraine's electricity grid to the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant has been repaired and restored, the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) said on Saturday. Even though all the six nuclear reactors of the plant are turned off, power is still needed to cool the fuel in them to avoid a meltdown.

88.title: 7 idols in illegal possession of dealer recovered in TN's Viluppuram
88.article_body: The idol wing CID of Tamil Nadu Police on Saturday said seven bronze idols were recovered from the illegal possession of a dealer in Viluppuram. An investigation is on to trace the temples from where they were allegedly stolen. The accused could not establish the provenance of the idols including those of Ardhanareshwar, Goddess Sivakami, Krishna and Buddha, police claimed.

89.title: Over 700 active Maoist supporters surrender in Odisha's Malkangiri
89.article_body: More than 700 active Maoist supporters, including 300 militia members, surrendered before the security forces in Odisha's Malkangiri on Saturday, police said. As per reports, the surrendered supporters used to assist in violent activities and were involved in the killing of security personnel and civilians, besides supplying logistics to Maoists. They burnt dress materials and effigies of Naxals.

90.title: Telangana to issue order for 10% quota for STs in state: CM KCR
90.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said a government order (GO) to implement a 10% quota for Scheduled Tribes (STs) in the state would be issued soon. Rao said PM Modi should either respect the GO or "use it as a rope to hang". KCR added that the original Bill has been awaiting the President's assent for the past five years.

91.title: 1.5 kg of heroin, ₹5 lakh cash recovered from 2 women in Punjab
91.article_body: The Punjab Police seized 1.50 kg of heroin and ₹5.09 lakh in cash from two women in Hoshiarpur. The items were seized during a special search operation being run to curb the drug menace across the district, Hoshiarpur SSP Sartaj Singh Chahal said. Notably, the accused have been booked under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act.

92.title: Will seek Interpol's help to crack Dhanbad judge murder case: CBI
92.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has petitioned before the Jharkhand High Court informing a bench that it'll seek Interpol's help to crack Dhanbad judge Uttam Anand's murder case. It told the court that some digital evidence need to be verified from the WhatsApp headquarters in America. It has written to the Home Ministry for its approval to approach Interpol.

93.title: Package with mobiles, drugs thrown inside Patiala jail; 1 arrested
93.article_body: The officials of Patiala jail have recovered a package containing several mobile phones, accessories, tobacco pouches and psychotropic drugs that was thrown into the prison premises from outside. One of the four persons who allegedly tossed the package inside the jail was apprehended by a team of jail officials. Police reportedly recovered 27 mobile phones from the package.

94.title: Woman gifts King Charles a pen after he gets angry at leaky pen, video surfaces
94.article_body: King Charles III was gifted a pen by a woman while he was greeting crowds in Cardiff on Friday. A video showed Charles laughing as the woman gifted him the pen and said, "Just in case." This came after a video showed King Charles getting angry at a leaky pen and saying, "I can't bear this bloody thing."

95.title: National Games is most important championship in Indian sport: Dhanraj Pillay
95.article_body: Former hockey captain Dhanraj Pillay said that the National Games is the "most important championship in Indian sport". "I was one of the many players picked up for the India camp after the National Games...I am happy the event is making its comeback after seven years," Pillay said. He added that the 1994 National Games gave Pune a "different look".

96.title: Enjoying watching your rise: Federer to Alcaraz for 1st Grand Slam, no. 1 spot
96.article_body: Congratulating 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz for winning his maiden Grand Slam title at US Open 2022 and becoming the youngest men's world number one in tennis history, 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer said, "Enjoying watching your rise." Federer thanked Alcaraz for the "kind words" following his retirement news. Alcaraz wrote, "Roger has been one of my idols...a source of inspiration!"

97.title: Section of priests oppose gold plating of Kedarnath inner walls
97.article_body: A section of priests in Kedarnath have opposed the gold plating of the walls inside the sanctum sanctorum of the temple. "Gold plating is damaging the temple walls...We cannot tolerate this tampering with the centuries-old traditions," said a pilgrimage priest. The four walls of the temple were covered with silver plates which are being replaced with gold plates.

98.title: Which are Ranbir Kapoor's top 5 grossing movies as 'Brahmāstra' takes 2nd spot?
98.article_body: 'Brahmāstra' has become the second-highest grossing movie of Ranbir Kapoor's career, with its all-India total standing at around ₹191.30 crore. It overtook 'Yeh Jawani Hai Deewani' (₹178 crore) to take the second spot. 'Sanju' is Ranbir's highest grossing film with ₹342.53 crore earnings. The fourth spot is held by 'Ae Dil Hai Mushkil' (₹112.48 crore), followed by 'Barfi!' (₹112.15 crore).

99.title: No madrasa will be bulldozed, Opp'n spreading rumours: UP minister
99.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Minority Welfare Minister Danish Azad Ansari on Saturday said that the Opposition is spreading rumours regarding the ongoing survey of madrasas in the state. "We will not run bulldozers on any madrasa," he added. He said the government is conducting the survey for the betterment of the madrasas, adding, "Our aim is to modernise [madrasas]."

100.title: Arms & ammunition recovered by security forces in J&K's Baramulla
100.article_body: Security forces recovered arms and ammunition in J&K's Baramulla district on Saturday, police said. A search operation was launched by police and Army after specific input regarding the presence of a cache of arms and ammunition in the Hathlanga area of Uri was received, police informed. One AK-47 rifle, one AK magazine, and 28 AK-47 rounds were recovered, police added.

101.title: Pics of Virat Kohli's new look ahead of Australia T20I series go viral
101.article_body: Pictures of Virat Kohli's new look ahead of the T20I series against Australia have gone viral on social media. Celebrity hairstylist Rashid Salmani took to Instagram to share Kohli's new look, writing, "With the king himself." "Dope," a fan commented on his picture, while another wrote, "Asia Cup 2022 look was better."

102.title: 70-year-old woman raped by 32-year-old drunk neighbour in Rajasthan
102.article_body: A 70-year-old woman was allegedly raped by her 32-year-old drunk neighbour on Friday in a village in Rajasthan's Dausa district. She was lying on a cot with her eight-year-old grandson when the man barged into her house and committed the crime, reports said. The woman, who was found in a bloodied state by her husband, is in a critical condition.

103.title: CPL has one of best team environments I've ever been in: De Kock
103.article_body: South African batter Quinton de Kock said that the CPL has "one of the better team environments" he has ever been in his professional career. "Coming to the CPL for the first time was a new challenge for me. However, the moment I walked in here, I was greeted by smiles," Quinton, who is representing the Barbados Royals, said.

104.title: J&K BJP organises blood donation camps to mark PM Modi's birthday
104.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir BJP organised blood donation camps on Saturday to mark PM Narendra Modi’s birthday. Over 1,200 units of blood were donated in over two dozen camps, a party spokesperson said. "BJP will embark on a fortnight-long nationwide drive of public outreach with initiatives like blood donation...and cleanliness measures," Jammu and Kashmir BJP President Ravinder Raina said.

105.title: Video from inside the plane that brought cheetahs to India surfaces
105.article_body: A video from inside the flight that carried eight cheetahs from Namibia to India's MP has surfaced on Twitter. The video, which was filmed shortly before the flight landed, shows the cheetahs- five females and three males- housed in cages on the plane. The animals were released into Kuno National Park from two release points, by PM Narendra Modi.

106.title: Germany's Oktoberfest opens after a break of 2 years
106.article_body: The world-famous Oktoberfest began in the German city of Munich on Saturday after a gap of two years. This year's Oktoberfest will go on till October 3 and is the 187th edition. The festival could not be held in 2020 and 2021 because of the COVID-19 pandemic. The Oktoberfest on average draws about 6 million visitors each year.

107.title: Not true: Punit refutes reports of playing Dev in 'Brahmastra...'
107.article_body: Actor-choreographer Punit Pathak has refuted reports that claimed he played the role of Dev in Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva'. "No no no, I have not shot it. It is not true, it is not right. I am not Dev in Brahmastra," he said. The film only shared a glimpse of the character and did not reveal the face.

108.title: Happiest birthday to our vera level all-rounder Ashwin: Karthik
108.article_body: Wishing India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin on his 36th birthday, teammate Dinesh Karthik tweeted, "Happiest birthday to our vera level all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin. Have a blast Ashley!" He added, "Brb [be right back]...birthday boy taking us on a trip." Virat Kohli took to Instagram Stories and wrote, "Happy birthday, Ash. Wishing you happiness and good health. Have a great day."

109.title: New Tunisian decree imposes 5-yr prison term for 'fake news'
109.article_body: Tunisia's President Kais Saied has issued a decree which imposes a jail term of up to 5 years for convictions in spreading "fake news" cases. The decree is defined as "using communication networks and information systems...to...send false information or rumours". The law says the jail term could be raised up to 10 years if the fake news targets top officials.

110.title: Nobody can play tennis like Federer, nobody probably will ever: Mouratoglou
110.article_body: Paying tribute to Roger Federer after he announced his retirement, Simona Halep's coach Patrick Mouratoglou said the 41-year-old Swiss plays tennis the way everybody would love to play tennis. "Roger is the best ambassador for tennis...nobody can play tennis like him, and nobody probably will ever play tennis the way [he] did," he added. Federer has won 20 Grand Slams.

111.title: 2 groups clash inside a gurdwara in Punjab's Faridkot
111.article_body: Members of two different groups clashed inside a gurdwara in Punjab's Faridkot district over the control of the committee that manages the shrine's affairs. Police have registered a case and arrested three people. Notably, in a video, groups can be seen clashing inside the sanctum sanctorum of the gurdwara located in the city's German Colony area.

112.title: UP Police SI booked for threatening to kill senior officer
112.article_body: An FIR was registered against a UP Police sub-inspector (SI) for allegedly threatening to kill a superintendent of police, officials said on Saturday. The accused, SI Rajendra Singh, was suspended and sent to jail following an incident in March where he shot and injured a neighbour, an official informed. Efforts are underway to arrest the accused policeman, the official added.

113.title: Pak PM to appoint next Army chief in November: Pak Defence Minister
113.article_body: Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif on Saturday said PM Shehbaz Sharif will appoint the country's next Army chief in November this year. Further, Asif accused ex-PM Imran Khan of creating controversy. Khan had earlier said Shehbaz was incompetent to make the military appointment and that the decision must be made after fresh elections are held.

114.title: SCO to prepare list of terror groups banned in member states
114.article_body: The Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) will prepare a list of separatist and terrorist groups that are banned on territories of member states. In a declaration, the SCO condemned terrorism in all forms and said the list will be made in accordance with the member countries' national laws. Foreign Secretary Vinay Kwatra said SCO members clearly recognise the threat of terrorism.

115.title: Overpowering director is worst thing you can do: Darshan on working with Kangana
115.article_body: Director Suneel Darshan, sharing his experience of working with Kangana Ranaut in the film 'Shakalaka Boom Boom', said he could sense that "something was amiss". "I also felt...overpowering a director is...worst thing that you can do to a film," he added. Suneel further said he's still a fan of Kangana's acting and believes that she should act in more movies.

116.title: 2-time CWG champion Bajrang loses in Wrestling World C'ships quarters
116.article_body: Two-time Commonwealth Games champion Bajrang Punia lost in the quarter-final at the Wrestling World Championships in Belgrade on Saturday. Yianni Diakomihalis of the USA beat the Indian wrestler 10-0 via technical superiority in the 65-kg category. If the American wrestler reaches the final, Bajrang will have a chance at the bronze medal through the repechage round.

117.title: CBI moves Delhi court to cancel Tejashwi Yadav's bail in IRCTC scam
117.article_body: The CBI has filed an application in a Delhi court seeking cancellation of bail to Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav in the IRCTC scam. The case relates to the maintenance contract of IRCTC hotels in which the agency had charged 12 people and two companies. Tejashwi and his mother Rabri Devi were granted bail in 2018.

118.title: Rohingya teenager in Bangladesh killed in shelling from Myanmar
118.article_body: A 15-year-old Rohingya boy was killed and six others were injured after mortar shells fired from Myanmar exploded on the Bangladeshi side of the Myanmar-Bangladesh border on Friday. The mortar shells landed in no man's land, a Bangladeshi official said, as per media reports. More than a million Rohingya are living in refugee camps in southern Bangladesh.

119.title: Mukesh Ambani makes biggest-ever donation of ₹1.5cr at Kerala's Guruvayur Temple
119.article_body: Billionaire industrialist Mukesh Ambani on Saturday visited Kerala's Guruvayur Shri Krishna Temple and made a donation of ₹1.5 crore, temple officials said. The temple said it was the biggest amount it has received in a single donation ever. This came a day after Ambani visited Lord Venkateshwara Shrine in Andhra Pradesh and made a similar ₹1.5 crore donation.

120.title: Indian hockey players to take legal action against ex-coach Marijne over allegations in book
120.article_body: Indian men's and women's hockey players said they will take a legal action against ex-coach Sjoerd Marijne over allegations he made in his book. Marijne alleged that Manpreet Singh asked a player "to stop playing well" so his friends could get into team. He also alleged ex-FIH president Narinder Batra didn't know the names of female players barring Rani Rampal.

121.title: Jersey worn by basketball legend Michael Jordan 24 years ago sells for over ₹80 crore
121.article_body: A jersey worn by basketball legend Michael Jordan during Game 1 of the 1998 NBA Finals, his last title victory, sold for a record $10.1 million (over ₹80 crore) on Thursday, Sotheby’s said. The Chicago Bulls jersey, with Jordan’s number 23 on the back, went for the highest amount of any game-worn sports memorabilia ever, the auction house said.

122.title: JD(U) has not given Prashant Kishor any offer to join: Party Prez
122.article_body: JD(U) President Rajiv Ranjan Lalan Singh said the party has not given Prashant Kishor any offer to join. "Prashant Kishor is not a political person. He's a businessman and does marketing to increase his business," said Singh, after Kishor met with Bihar CM Nitish Kumar recently. Singh said he had told Kishor to "accept the party's decision irrespective of opinions".

123.title: Hyd Liberation Day wasn't celebrated due to vote bank politics: Shah
123.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah said despite demand from the people, the Telangana government would not "dare to celebrate" Hyderabad Liberation Day due to "vote bank politics". Shah added that the TRS backed out of their election promises "due to fear of Razakars". He also said Hyderabad would not have been part of India if it wasn't for Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel.

124.title: BSF seizes mobile phones worth ₹39 lakh along India-B'desh border
124.article_body: The BSF has seized mobile phones worth ₹39,29,000 in West Bengal's Malda district near the India-Bangladesh International Border. Acting on intelligence inputs, the BSF seized a consignment of 359 mobile phones from "10 to 12 suspected smugglers" who fled seeing the troops. BSF says the names of many Indian smugglers involved in the ring have come up.

125.title: BJP govt against backward classes, poor: Akhilesh Yadav
125.article_body: Former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav accused the BJP-led state government of being against the backward classes and poor people. The Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticised the state government for cancelling the public holiday on Vishwakarma Jayanti, which is being celebrated on Saturday across the country. He added that the BJP has insulted the Vishwakarma community.

126.title: BJP will lose upcoming Himachal Assembly polls: State Cong chief
126.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Pratibha Singh said that the BJP will lose in the upcoming state Assembly polls. "The defeat of BJP-supported candidates [in the university elections] has made it clear that the wind of change of power is intact in the state," Pratibha said. She added, "Congress will remove the discrimination being faced by the employees."

127.title: Rajnath Singh to embark on 3-day Egypt visit to boost defence ties
127.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will embark on a three-day visit to Egypt from Sunday. The visit aims to further consolidate defence cooperation and the special friendship between India and Egypt, a press release by the Defence Ministry said. A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) will be signed to provide further impetus to enhance defence cooperation between the two countries, it added.

128.title: Salman Khan wishes PM 'Narendra bhai Modi' on his 72nd birthday
128.article_body: Actor Salman Khan took to Twitter on Saturday to wish Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his 72nd birthday. "Wishing our hon Prime Minister Narendra bhai Modi a very happy birthday, @narendramodi," he wrote. Meanwhile, actress Alia Bhatt tweeted, "Happy Birthday to our Hon'ble @PMOIndia @narendramodi ji. Here's wishing you good health and a lifetime of inspiring leadership."

129.title: Chrissy shares screenshots of hate comments she got after revealing she had abortion
129.article_body: Model Chrissy Teigen took to Twitter to share screenshots of hate comments directed at her on Instagram after her revelation that she underwent "life-saving" abortion and not miscarriage in 2020. "Stop milking this story," a user wrote. "I knew this would happen...and honestly I've already seen you do your worst so if this makes you feel better, great," Chrissy wrote.

130.title: S Africans seek return of world's largest clear-cut diamond after Queen's death
130.article_body: Demands have grown in South Africa to bring back the 500-carat diamond known as the 'Great Star of Africa' or Cullinan I, which is the world's largest known clear-cut diamond. Over 6,000 South Africans have signed an online petition seeking its return after Queen Elizabeth II's death. The diamond, as big as a human heart, currently adorns the Queen's sceptre.

131.title: Don't start this nonsense about Virat Kohli opening the batting: Gautam Gambhir
131.article_body: Referring to several people stating Virat Kohli should open the batting for India in T20 World Cup 2022, Gautam Gambhir said, "Don't start this nonsense about him opening...He can't open...with KL Rahul and Rohit Sharma available." He added, "There shouldn't even be a debate about this." Notably, Kohli slammed his maiden T20I hundred while opening against Afghanistan in Asia Cup.

132.title: Man City beat 10-man Wolves 3-0 in PL, move to top of the standings
132.article_body: Jack Grealish's goal inside 60 seconds and Erling Haaland's 11th Premier League goal of the season helped Manchester City beat 10-man Wolverhampton Wanderers 3-0 on Saturday. Phil Foden netted a third in the 69th minute as the defending champions moved to the top of the Premier League standings. Manchester City have 17 points from seven matches so far.

133.title: Protests erupt at funeral of Iranian woman allegedly beaten by police
133.article_body: Protests broke out at the funeral of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini who died on Friday after allegedly being assaulted by police in Iran over "improper hijab", Reuters reported. Videos posted on social media reportedly showed protesters shouting anti-government slogans after gathering in Saqqez, Amini's hometown. Security forces fired tear gas to disperse demonstrators, as per Reuters.

134.title: 7 dead, several hurt as bus falls off bridge in J'khand; 'Anguished,' says PM
134.article_body: At least seven people were killed and several others were injured after a bus carrying around 50 passengers fell off a bridge in Jharkhand's Hazaribag on Saturday, police said. A rescue operation is underway as some passengers are still trapped in the bus, Hazaribag SP said. "Anguished by the loss of lives in the bus accident," PM Narendra Modi tweeted.

135.title: New world record set as 87,000 donate blood on PM's birthday: Health Minister
135.article_body: Over 87,000 people voluntarily donated blood on PM Narendra Modi's birthday on Saturday, setting a new world record, Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said. "This is an invaluable gift from the country to our beloved Pradhan Sevak," said Mandaviya. A countrywide 15-day voluntary blood donation drive has been launched starting today and ending on October 1.

136.title: Hrithik recalls doctors telling him he 'can't do action films and dance'
136.article_body: Hrithik Roshan spoke about the time when doctors told him that he can't do action films and dance. He said, "When I did 'Kaho Naa...Pyaar Hai', doctors had said that my health condition is not so good. That I can't do action films and dance." Hrithik added that he took it as a challenge and paid attention to his health.

137.title: AAP MLA Amanatullah sent to 4-day police custody in corruption case
137.article_body: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan was on Saturday sent to four-day police custody in the Delhi Waqf Board corruption case. The order was issued by a special Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) court at Rouse Avenue. Khan was arrested late on Friday by the Anti-Corruption Branch (ACB) after raids at the residences of the MLA and his aide.

138.title: India didn't give freebies during pandemic, gave ration to 80 cr people: UP CM
138.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday claimed that India was the only country in the world that did not give freebies during the COVID-19 pandemic, but helped 80 crore people with free ration. Addressing a gathering in Lucknow after inaugurating an exhibition to mark PM Modi's birthday, he said, "More than 200 crore free vaccine doses were...made available."

139.title: Your mantra should be skilling, reskilling & upskilling: PM Modi to youth
139.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi gave the mantra of "skilling, reskilling and upskilling" to the youth of the country. Addressing the Kaushal Dikshant Samaroh, he advised the youth to innovate and constantly update their abilities in accordance with the changing times. The Centre will launch more than 5,000 new 'skill hubs' in order to support skill development, PM Modi added.

140.title: Several women injured after bus collides against bridge in UP
140.article_body: Over two dozen women were injured after the bus they were travelling in collided against a bridge in Uttar Pradesh. The bus was carrying people returning from Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Women's Self-Help Group (SHG) programme held in Madhya Pradesh's Karahal Tehsil. The bus could not reach the programme due to a traffic jam.

141.title: Shah to visit Bihar next week for 1st time after JD(U)-BJP break up
141.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah will visit Bihar on September 23 and 24, BJP state President Sanjay Jaiswal said on Saturday. This will be Shah's first visit to Bihar after CM Nitish Kumar-led JD(U) broke ties with BJP. Jaiswal said Shah will address a big public gathering in Purnia and will meet the office bearers of Araria, Kishanganj, Purnia and Katihar.

142.title: Team India will be happy that he is scoring runs: Johnson on Kohli
142.article_body: Former Australia pacer Mitchell Johnson has said Team India will be happy with batter Virat Kohli scoring runs again. This month, Kohli ended his 1,019-day international century drought by smashing his 71st hundred against Afghanistan in the Asia Cup 2022. With 276 runs from five matches, Kohli finished as the second-highest run scorer in the Asia Cup.

143.title: 74 yrs ago, Sardar Patel came to unite, now Amit Shah came to divide: KT Rao
143.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao accused Union Home Minister Amit Shah of doing "divisive politics". Rao said, "74 years ago, a Union Home Minister (Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel) came to unite and integrate the people of Telangana." He added, "Today [Amit Shah] has come to divide and bully." Shah visited the state on the occasion of Hyderabad Liberation Day on Saturday.

144.title: Rohit never looks out of form whether he's scoring runs or not: Narine
144.article_body: West Indies spinner Sunil Narine lauded Rohit Sharma, saying the India captain is a quality player and there is no doubt about his ability. "I think once he is on the go, he is one of the best batters to watch. He is always in form, never looks out of form whether he is scoring runs or not," he added.

145.title: 45-year-old man injured in crocodile attack in Odisha's Kendrapara
145.article_body: A 45-year-old man was attacked by a crocodile in Odisha's Kendrapara district on Saturday, an official said. He sustained multiple wounds and is undergoing treatment. The victim was taking a bath in the Brahmani river when the incident occurred, PTI reported. The crocodile tried to pull the man into the deep water but he was rescued by locals.

146.title: Original Shiv Sena can't be snatched away or purchased: Uddhav
146.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday said that the "original" Shiv Sena was "born out of decades of social work", adding that the party cannot be "snatched away or purchased". This comes amid the ongoing tussle between the factions led by Thackeray and Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde over the right to use Shiv Sena's poll symbol.

147.title: 'World's first flying bike' debuts at US event, video goes viral
147.article_body: Japanese-made hoverbike XTURISMO, which is widely regarded as the world's first flying bike, debuted at a US auto show on Thursday. A video of a show official test-driving the bike has gone viral online. XTURISMO maker AERWINS Technologies plans to launch it in the US next year with its price pegged at $777,000 (around ₹6.18 crore).

148.title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
148.article_body: The IMD has issued heavy rainfall warning for several states. Heavy rainfall is very likely over UP and MP on September 20 and 21. It's likely over Chhattisgarh from September 19 to 21, over Andaman and Nicobar Islands till September 20 and over Odisha from September 18-21. Very heavy rainfall is likely over Odisha on September 20 and 21.

149.title: We'll wrap it up by Dec, it'll be an early 2023 release: Sunny on Gadar 2
149.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol has said he's very confident about his upcoming film 'Gadar 2', the sequel to the 2001 film 'Gadar: Ek Prem Katha'. "Whomever I meet wants to see something and we are giving them that in Gadar," he added. Sunny further said the film will be completed by December and will release in early 2023.

150.title: TN shopkeeper denies candies to Dalit kids, arrested after video emerges
150.article_body: A shopkeeper and a village leader were arrested on Saturday after the former denied candies to Dalit children in Tamil Nadu's Tenkasi. This comes after a viral video showed the shopkeeper, Maheshwaran, telling the children that village authorities have imposed a restriction against selling anything to residents of a particular street. "You shouldn't buy...[candies] from...shops here," he added.

151.title: I feel 'boycott Bollywood' campaign is extremely good: Vivek Agnihotri
151.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri said in an interview that he feels the 'boycott Bollywood' campaign is "extremely good" as it shows people's frustration with the kind of films that Bollywood is producing. 'The Kashmir Files' director added that its end result will be "very positive". When asked if he considers himself a part of Bollywood, Vivek replied, "No, I'm not."

152.title: Goa CM calls for preserving coastline to boost blue economy
152.article_body: The Goa government on Saturday carried out a cleanliness drive at 37 beaches, where CM Pramod Sawant stressed the need to preserve the coastline for boosting blue economy. "We should pledge to continue working with unity for a better, safe and sustainable future," Sawant tweeted. The state tourism department organised cleanliness drive on the occasion of PM Narendra Modi's birthday.

153.title: Midnight fire guts 6 vehicles in Pune
153.article_body: A midnight fire broke out at a parking lot of Hareshwar Park residential society, Manajinagar in Pune's Narhe on Saturday. The fire gutted six vehicles, including two cars, before the firefighters reached the spot and brought the situation under control. Fire officer Prakash Gore cited short-circuit as the possible reason for the blaze. Notably, the investigation is still on.

154.title: Youth marking PM Modi's birthday as 'National Unemployment Day': Cong
154.article_body: The Congress on Saturday claimed that the youth of the country are marking PM Narendra Modi's birthday as "National Unemployment Day". They demanded that he provide employment to them as promised. "In fact, in the 20-24 age group, 42% of the youth are unemployed. If this is not a worrying situation, I wonder what is," Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate said.

155.title: Bidar-Ballari road will be made a 4-lane express highway: K'taka CM
155.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Saturday announced that the existing Bidar-Ballari road will be made a four-lane express highway. Speaking in Kalaburagi, Bommai said the proposed express highway will play an important role in improving the road connectivity in the region. A ring road has been proposed covering Yadgir, Raichur and Kalaburagi with the Centre's assistance, Bommai added.

156.title: 32 gold bars worth ₹1.64 crore found in plane's toilet in Chennai
156.article_body: As many as 32 gold bars, weighing 3.73 kilograms, worth ₹1.64 crore were seized from an aeroplane that arrived in Chennai from Dubai at the city airport, Customs authorities said on Saturday. Officials, while rummaging the aircraft belonging to a private airline, found the gold bars concealed in the front toilet of the plane, according to an official release.

157.title: 2 men electrocuted after coming in contact with electric wire in UP
157.article_body: Two men were electrocuted to death after they came in contact with an electric wire in Uttar Pradesh's Balrampur, a police officer said on Saturday. The deceased were identified as 33-year-old Anup Yadav and 40-year-old Virendra Yadav. Anup came in contact with the wire while removing a wooden pole in his field and Virendra was electrocuted while rescuing him.

158.title: Which popular brands risk losing royal seal after Queen Elizabeth's death?
158.article_body: Around 600 brands favoured by Queen Elizabeth II are at the risk of losing the royal seal and must await King Charles III's approval. Burberry raincoats, Cadbury chocolates, Twinings teas and coffees, Launer handbags and Moet and Chandon champagne are among them. Dubonnet wine-based aperitif and Barbour jackets were favoured by the Queen, as were Heinz ketchup and Kellogg's cereal.

159.title: Class: Patrick on Federer announcing his retirement after the end of US Open
159.article_body: Praising Roger Federer for the timing of announcing his retirement, ex-tennis player Patrick McEnroe said, "He waited until well after the US Open ended until he went public...Class." US Open, the last Grand Slam of the year, ended on September 11. Federer announced the news on Thursday, saying that he will be retiring after next week's Laver Cup in London.

160.title: Satellite pics show massive queues to see Queen's coffin in London
160.article_body: Maxar's satellite pictures have shown the massive miles-long queues to view Queen Elizabeth II lying-in-state at London's Westminster Hall. Tens of thousands joined the queue, when it opened on Wednesday (September 14), to pay their last respects to the UK's longest-ruling monarch. Queen Elizabeth's funeral, which will be attended by world leaders, is scheduled for Monday (September 19).

161.title: I have changed: Hales after making a comeback to Eng squad after 3 years
161.article_body: After making a comeback to the England squad for the first time since 2019, batter Alex Hales said that he has "changed" in the past three years. "I'm comfortably into my 30s now and turning into a veteran," Hales said. "It was disappointing not to be in the team for three years," he added.

162.title: Bomb explodes on terrace of school in West Bengal; none injured
162.article_body: A bomb exploded on the terrace of Titagarh Free India High School in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas district on Saturday. Police have reached the spot and are investigating whether someone threw the bomb from outside or if it was stored on the roof. So far, no injuries have been reported in the incident, as per reports.

163.title: Angad Bedi, Kirti Kulhari to reunite after 6 years for 'The List'
163.article_body: Actors Angad Bedi and Kirti Kulhari are teaming up again, after the 2016 movie 'Pink', for a short film titled 'The List'. It's a futuristic drama which is directed by Gaurav Dave. Speaking about the film, Angad said, "The film is...a commentary on how robotic our...lives have become and Gaurav truly believed...Kirti and I'd be able to manifest this on-screen."

164.title: You are the motivation of young India: Saaina to PM Modi on his 72nd birthday
164.article_body: Indian shuttler Saaina Nehwal took to Twitter on PM Narendra Modi's 72nd birthday and wrote, "May God give you good health and long life. You are the motivation of young India and the role model of every ordinary person." CWG 2022 gold medal-winning weightlifter Mirabai Chanu tweeted, "Wishing you a long and healthy life in the service of the nation."

165.title: Delhi recorded this year's first 'good' air quality day on Friday
165.article_body: Delhi recorded this year's first 'good' air quality day on Friday with AQI of 47. AQI till 50 is considered 'good', while AQI of 51 to 100 is classified as 'satisfactory' which could lead to "minor breathing discomfort to sensitive people", as per the Central Pollution Control Board. Delhi recorded only one day of good air quality last year.

166.title: Federer to get warm farewell at Swiss Indoors Basel: Tournament Prez Brennwald
166.article_body: Swiss Roger Federer will be given a "warm farewell" in St Jakobshalle, said President of Swiss Indoors Basel ATP 500 tournament Roger Brennwald. "Further information will follow at a later date," he added. Federer has won a record 10 singles titles in Basel. The 20-time Grand Slam champion will be retiring after next week's Laver Cup.

167.title: 3 injured after SUV rams into vehicle carrying iron rods in NCR
167.article_body: Three people were seriously injured after an SUV rammed into a tractor-trolley, carrying iron rods, from behind on the Delhi-Gurugram national highway on Saturday, police said. The iron rods protruding from the tractor-trolley pierced through the SUV, injuring three of its five occupants, as per an eyewitness. The rods pierced through the neck of the car's driver, the eyewitness added.

168.title: More AAP MLAs will be arrested: Kejriwal after Amanatullah's arrest
168.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said that following the arrest of Amanatullah Khan, several other AAP MLAs will face arrest in the coming days. "It seems they (BJP) are hurt badly in Gujarat," Kejriwal added. AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan was arrested on Friday by Delhi Anti-Corruption Branch in a case linked to the Delhi Waqf Board.

169.title: TN BJP to gift ₹5,000 gold rings to newborns on PM Modi's birthday
169.article_body: BJP's Tamil Nadu unit has planned to gift gold rings to newborns at a government hospital in Chennai on PM Narendra Modi's birthday. "All children born [at RSRM hospital] on [PM's] birthday will be given a...ring," minister L Murugan said. He estimated that each ring will cost approximately ₹5,000. The party expects about 10-15 deliveries at the hospital today (Saturday).

170.title: NDMC to revamp 41 roads ahead of India's G-20 presidency
170.article_body: Before India assumes the presidency of G-20 this December, the New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) will revamp 41 roads and major traffic circles in the city at a cost of ₹85 crore. The municipality has set a deadline of four months to finish the work. During India's G-20 presidency, 12,000 delegates will visit the capital, officials said.

171.title: Congo Prez's top aide caught demanding bribe on tape, resigns
171.article_body: A top adviser of Congolese President Felix Tshisekedi resigned on Friday after he was allegedly caught on tape negotiating kickbacks on a mineral deal. Media organisation Organised Crime and Corruption Reporting Project said Vidiye Tshimanga was recorded negotiating his "percentage" for the deal by two individuals posing as mineral investors. Tshimanga has refuted the allegations against himself.

172.title: Ranvir Shorey’s father, filmmaker Krishan Dev Shorey, passes away at 92
172.article_body: Actor Ranvir Shorey’s father, filmmaker Krishan Dev Shorey, passed away aged 92 on Friday night. Ranvir took to Instagram to condole his father’s death, and called him his "greatest source of inspiration and protection". KD Shorey produced several films in the 1980s and 1990s under his banner KDS Films.

173.title: Pune municipal schools facing shortage of teachers: NCP leader
173.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Nitin Kadam said there is a shortage of English-medium teachers in schools under Pune Municipal Corporation. He said many parents lost their income source during the COVID-19 pandemic and so many children were transferred to municipal schools from private English ones. Kadam said there is a shortage of teachers for these new students.

174.title: PMPML criticised for cutting e-bus fleet in Pune for ops in Satara
