348.title: I have always looked up to you and admired you: Serena Williams to Roger Federer
348.article_body: Penning a note for Roger Federer following his retirement from tennis, Serena Williams wrote on Instagram, "I have always looked up to you and admired you." She added, "You inspired countless millions and millions of people, including me, and we will never forget." She further wrote, "Welcome to the retirement club. And thank you for being you @rogerfederer."

349.title: Heavy rains claim at least 22 lives in UP
349.article_body: Heavy overnight rains killed at least 22 people in Uttar Pradesh on Friday. The deaths included nine labourers from Jhansi, who died after an under-construction wall collapsed on their huts in Lucknow. Only one man survived the accident. The remaining 13 deaths were reported from Unnao, Fatehpur, Prayagraj, Sitapur, Raebareli and Jhansi, officials said.

350.title: Live-stream proceedings of national importance: Indira Jaising to SC
350.article_body: Senior advocate Indira Jaising has written a letter to Chief Justice of India UU Lalit and other Supreme Court judges urging them to begin live-streaming of proceedings of matters of national importance. Citing freedom of information, she added, "There is no substitute for first-hand knowledge, especially in the era of...'fake news'." Jaising said the apex court should've its own channel.

351.title: PM Modi thanks Uzbek Prez for hosting SCO summit; discusses ties
351.article_body: PM Narendra Modi met Uzbekistan President Shavkat Mirziyoyev in Samarkand on Friday. "Had a great meeting with President Shavkat Mirziyoyev. Thanked him for hosting the SCO (Shanghai Cooperation Organisation) Summit," Modi tweeted. The two leaders discussed "ways to deepen connectivity, trade and cultural cooperation between India and Uzbekistan", according to the tweet.

352.title: German Chancellor Scholz, US Speaker Pelosi meet amid Ukraine war
352.article_body: US Speaker Nancy Pelosi met German Chancellor Olaf Scholz in Berlin on Friday, with talks centred around the Russia-Ukraine war. "We will persist until the guns are silent," said Pelosi. "It (Ukrainian success) requires substantial security support, humanitarian assistance, economic assistance- and sanctions...that make sure that Russia feels the pain of this," she added.

353.title: I thought Kuldeep could've been picked for WC: Ex-India selector
353.article_body: Former India selector Sarandeep Singh said that spinner Kuldeep Yadav could have been picked in the Indian squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "You need a wrist spinner in Australia, but then he (Kuldeep) wasn't really in the scheme of things," Sarandeep said. "[Selectors] didn't want to take any risk, especially after losing in the Asia Cup," he added.

354.title: Shami shouldn't have been left out of T20 WC squad: Sarandeep
354.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Sarandeep Singh said that pacer Mohammad Shami "shouldn't have gone out" from the 15-member squad of the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia. "The way he (Shami) performed for Gujarat, he should have been there in the main squad. Additionally, what he can do with the new ball, I don't think any other bowler can," Sarandeep said.

355.title: India Maharajas defeat World Giants in match to mark India's 75 years of independence
355.article_body: Harbhajan Singh-led India Maharajas defeated Jacques Kallis-led World Giants by six wickets in a special T20 match to mark India's 75 years of independence. Batting first, World Giants put up a total of 170/8 in their 20 overs, with Kevin O'Brien top-scoring with 52(31). India Maharajas chased down target in 18.4 overs as Tanmay Srivastava and Yusuf Pathan scored fifties.

356.title: Australia had a rule to never sledge Sachin while he's batting: Brett Lee
356.article_body: Former Australian pacer Brett Lee said his team never sledged Sachin Tendulkar as "he will (then) be batting out there forever". "Sachin Tendulkar on the field is completely different...you look into his eyes, the eyes of a tiger. He wants it, wants to get into the battle," said Lee. Sachin has scored 20 centuries in total against the Australians.

357.title: 2 people dead after being hit by train in Kerala
357.article_body: Two people died after a train hit them at the Auvaneeswaram Railway Station near Kollam, Kerala on Friday. The deceased were identified as Sajeena (39) and Rahimkutty (62). The railway station doesn't have a foot overbridge and the deceased died when they were on the track, police said. Notably, Rahimkutty was a local panchayat member.

358.title: Former Lankan Prez Sirisena named suspect in 2019 terror attacks
358.article_body: A court in Sri Lanka on Friday named ex-President Maithripala Sirisena as a suspect in the Easter Sunday terrorist bombings of 2019 which killed 270 people in the country. The Colombo Fort Magistrate's Court said 71-year-old Sirisena had neglected intelligence reports which were presented before the bombings. Sirisena's court appearance is scheduled on October 14.

359.title: Rare deep-sea shark with bulging eyes caught in Australia, pic goes viral
359.article_body: A rare deep-sea shark with bulging eyes was pulled lifeless off the Australian coast by a fisherman. The shark was caught from 2,133 feet underwater. Reacting to shark's viral picture, a social media user wrote, "Stuff of nightmares there." Meanwhile, another user wrote, "Looks really happy he's just had his braces off so is accentuating the gums and teeth."

360.title: Don't become a line-length bowler: Curtly Ambrose to Raj Angad Bawa
360.article_body: All-rounder Raj Angad Bawa revealed that West Indian legend Curtly Ambrose has advised him to not lose his pace. "You can trouble the best...with the kind of steep bounce you generate...Don't become a line-length bowler," Ambrose had told the youngster. Bawa earned his maiden India A call-up for a New Zealand A series starting on September 22 in Chennai.

361.title: Defending champions India lose in SAFF Women's Championship 2022 semis
361.article_body: Defending champions India crashed out of the SAFF Women's Championship 2022 after a 0-1 loss against hosts Nepal in the semi-final in Kathmandu on Friday. Rashmi Kumari Ghising scored the only goal of the game in injury time of the first half. Notably, India have lost in semi-final stage for the first time in the history of the tournament.

362.title: Seems that Congress doesn't need me anymore: 91-yr-old Karan Singh
362.article_body: Veteran Congress leader Karan Singh stated that he has been in the party for his whole life but it seems that it doesn't need him anymore. "I've not been invited for the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'...Neither I'm on any [Congress] committee...nor has the party consulted me for some years," the 91-year-old added. He said that he feels separated from the party.

363.title: Auto-rickshaw driver stabbed in Gurugram for denying ride
363.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver was allegedly stabbed by two people in Gurugram after he denied a ride to them, police said on Friday. The victim in his complaint said that the incident took place on Wednesday while he was waiting for passengers at IFFCO Chowk. The victim was stabbed in the shoulder by two drunk youths, as per his complaint.

364.title: Extreme hunger rose 123% in climate change-hit countries: Ofxam
364.article_body: Extreme hunger has increased by 123% in the last six years in countries which are most affected by climate change, Oxfam has reported. It stated that 48 million people in Afghanistan, Burkina Faso, Djibouti, Guatemala, Haiti, Kenya, Madagascar, Niger, Somalia and Zimbabwe have experienced acute hunger. In 2018, 21 million people experienced acute hunger in these countries.

365.title: PSG manager looking to drop one of Messi, Neymar or Mbappe: Report
365.article_body: PSG manager Christophe Galtier is reportedly considering dropping one of Lionel Messi, Neymar or Kylian Mbappe to adjust his tactics. Galtier is reportedly planning to move away from his 3-4-3 formation as he feels its impact has lessened. The manager is said to consider dropping one of the trio for a forward who is willing to hold shape and press.

366.title: Real Madrid looking to organise Nadal-Federer match at Bernabeu: Report
366.article_body: Spanish football club Real Madrid reportedly wants to organise a tennis match between Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal at the Santiago Bernabeu stadium. The arena is currently undergoing renovation and will only fully be ready at the end of 2022. Federer announced his retirement from tennis on Thursday, while Nadal is an honourary member of the La Liga team.

367.title: Nikki Tamboli met Sukesh in jail, received ₹3.5 lakh cash, Gucci bag from him: ED
367.article_body: Television actress Nikki Tamboli's name has come up amid ongoing investigation in the money laundering case against conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar. According to ED, she met Sukesh while he was in jail. Tamboli received ₹3.5 lakh cash and a Gucci bag from Sukesh, ED stated in its chargesheet, obtained by India Today.

368.title: Queen Elizabeth's funeral security may cost ₹60 crore: Ex-royal security officer
368.article_body: Former royal security officer Simon Morgan has predicted that the cost of the security detail for Queen Elizabeth II's funeral will cost more than $7.5 million (around ₹59.76 crore), the New York Post reported. The British Mi5 and Mi6 intelligence agencies will work with London’s Metropolitan Police and Secret Service to secure the VIPs attending the funeral, the report said.

369.title: Never thought I wouldn’t be a part of 'The Kapil Sharma Show' anymore: Ali Asgar
369.article_body: Actor Ali Asgar recently said he never thought he wouldn't be a part of 'The Kapil Sharma Show' anymore. "After the incident (him quitting the show), there has been no communication (with Kapil)," he said. "So it's difficult to say if we would reunite or not...The day something good comes up, we might be together again," Ali added.

370.title: Beckham waits over 12 hrs in line to see Queen Elizabeth's coffin, pics surface
370.article_body: English football icon David Beckham on Friday turned up with thousands of other people standing in queue to see Queen Elizabeth lie-in-state at Westminster Hall in London. Beckham was pictured paying his last respects to the late monarch after waiting in line for over 12 hours. "I was so lucky...to have a few moments...to be around Her Majesty," he said.

371.title: IT park at a cost ₹600 cr to come up in Madurai: TN CM Stalin
371.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Friday announced that an information technology (IT) park would be set up in Madurai at a cost of ₹600 crore. "The park will be set up in two phases in Madurai's downtown Maatuthavani," Stalin stated. He added that the IT park would come up on a five-acre campus in the first phase.

372.title: 15-year-old Pranav Anand becomes India's 76th chess Grandmaster
372.article_body: Pranav Anand has become India's 76th Grandmaster after crossing 2,500 Elo mark in the ongoing World Youth Chess Championship in Mamaia, Romania. The 15-year-old had scored the third and final GM norm at 55th Biel Chess Festival in Switzerland in July. His first two GM norms came in Sitges Open (January 2022) and Vezerkepso GM Round Robin (March 2022) tournaments.

373.title: Sri Lanka announce their squad for T20 World Cup 2022
373.article_body: Asia Cup 2022 champions Sri Lanka on Friday announced their squad for T20 World Cup 2022. Dinesh Chandimal, the veteran middle-order batter, who made a return to the T20I squad in Asia Cup, has been named as a standby player. Sri Lanka also named Dushmantha Chameera and Lahiru Kumara, but their participation will be subject to their fitness.

374.title: Ambulance arrives in middle of ground as Venkatesh Iyer gets hit on head, pic surfaces
374.article_body: During the Duleep Trophy semi-final between Central Zone and West Zone, an ambulance arrived in the middle of the ground after Central Zone's Venkatesh Iyer was hit on the head. West Zone bowler Chintan Gaja picked ball and threw it back at Iyer in anger, after which Iyer went down in pain. However, Iyer preferred to walk off the field.

375.title: Shoaib Akhtar criticises Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 squad selection, shares video
375.article_body: Ex-Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar criticised Pakistan's T20 World Cup squad selection. In a video, he called Pakistan's chief selector "average", adding that when chief selector would be average, his selection would also be average. He further said that T20I cricket is not Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq's forte. "I'm really scared as our batting has no depth," Akhtar stated.

376.title: Leonardo DiCaprio is a very nice man: Gigi Hadid's father amid dating rumours
376.article_body: Commenting on his daughter's rumoured relationship with Hollywood actor Leonardo DiCaprio, model Gigi's father Mohamed Hadid said, "They've known each other for some time." "I've not spoken to my daughter about [him]...I don't think they're dating, I believe they're just good friends," he said. Adding that he met DiCaprio a few years ago, Hadid said, "He's a very nice man."

377.title: Thank God Manmohan Singh did not serve over-cooked food like GST: Chidambaram
377.article_body: Congress MP P Chidambaram commented after Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman reportedly said that the 1991 reforms brought in by the then Finance Minister Manmohan Singh were "half-baked". "Thank God, Dr Manmohan Singh did not serve over-cooked and unpalatable food like demonetisation, multiple-rates GST and savage taxes on petrol & diesel," Chidambaram tweeted.

378.title: Shashi's son shares old pic featuring King Charles III on 'Ahista Ahista' set
378.article_body: Late actor Shashi Kapoor's son Kunal Kapoor took to Instagram to share a throwback picture featuring King Charles III. "On the set - 1st schedule of my 1st film Ahista Ahista," he captioned the post. In the picture, King Charles III could be seen posing for the camera, with Kunal smiling behind him. The film was released in 1981.

379.title: We were 20 runs short: Harmanpreet on 7-wicket loss in 3rd T20I vs England
379.article_body: After India Women's seven-wicket defeat against England Women in third and final T20I, India captain Harmanpreet Kaur said her side was 20 runs short. "Credit to our bowlers for keeping us in the game...One needs to have a decent total in any format of the game. We need partnerships with...bat," she added. India lost the T20I series 1-2.

380.title: All Punjab decisions taken by Delhi AAP leaders: Ex-CM Amarinder
380.article_body: Former Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh said all state decisions are being taken by either AAP's Raghav Chadha or Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. "They are not letting poor CM (Bhagwant Mann) function," said Singh, adding that the AAP is making "unnecessary noises" about Operation Lotus to "divert attention". Singh also said he's "101% against" the Agnipath scheme.

381.title: Book 'Modi@20' can be used as management textbook: FM
381.article_body: The book on PM Narendra Modi titled 'Modi@20: Dreams Meet Delivery' can be used as a textbook in management courses, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Thursday. "It's a book which tells how modern-day governance in a complex economy like India can happen," she added. The book is penned by Amit Shah, Anupam Kher, Amish Tripathi and Sadhguru, among others.

382.title: Why create hubbub when nothing to hide: Naqvi on UP madrasa survey
382.article_body: Speaking about the controversy over the ongoing survey of private madrasas by the UP government, senior BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Friday said, "Why create a hubbub when there is nothing to hide?" Naqvi also said that doubts should not be raised on "all madrasas". The UP government on Monday began surveying "unrecognised" madrasas in the state.

383.title: Turkey to pay for 25% Russian gas supplies in roubles, says Putin
383.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said that Russia would soon receive 25% of payment for gas exports to Turkey in roubles. He added that an agreement in this regard would come into force in "the near future". Putin was speaking during a meeting with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on the sidelines of the ongoing Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit.

384.title: Sometimes repeating is closest to reliving: Sara recreates 'Kedarnath' look
384.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan took to Instagram on Friday and shared a picture of her recreating her own look from the film 'Kedarnath'. "Decided to repeat my Kedarnath wardrobe. Sometimes repeating is the closest to reliving," she wrote. 'Kedarnath', which also featured late actor Sushant Singh Rajput, marked Sara's acting debut in Bollywood. The film was released in 2018.

385.title: Haaland is the perfect person to manage: Man City manager Guardiola
385.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola praised Erling Haaland, saying the 22-year-old is an "exceptional striker" and the "perfect person" to manage. "At the age that he is, his ambition, he wants to be better and will be better," he added. Haaland was named Premier League 'Player of the Month' for August on Friday. Manchester City are currently second in standings.

386.title: Patanjali working on lumpy skin disease solution: Baba Ramdev
386.article_body: Baba Ramdev said his Patanjali Group is working on finding solutions for the lumpy skin disease that has caused the deaths of over 1 lakh cows since July. Ramdev also alleged that the disease might have "come from Pakistan". He added that the disease affected many cows in his shelter house in Haridwar but so far no cow had died.

387.title: Fire breaks out at poha factory in Ujjain; 3 women dead
387.article_body: Three women were charred to death after a fire broke out at Bindal poha factory located in Udyogpuri in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain on Friday. The women were working inside the factory at the time of the incident. Another woman who was critically injured in the fire was rushed to hospital. The fire brigade reached the spot and controlled the fire.

388.title: Money, power & other means being used to topple govts: NCP chief
388.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Thursday criticised the BJP and said that money, power and other means were being used to topple governments in the country. "In Maharashtra, 40 to 50 MLAs defected and the government changed," Pawar said. He further alleged that central probe agencies were being misused to target opposition parties and their leaders.

389.title: Supreme Court gives Centre time till December 15 to implement OROP
389.article_body: Supreme Court has allowed the Centre time till December 15 to implement the One Rank One Pension (OROP) scheme. The Centre had moved an application to extend the June deadline stating that re-fixation of pension is a "time consuming" process. The Centre assured the bench that it was "taking earnest steps" to comply with the order which requires Cabinet approval.

390.title: Cong not doing 'Bharat Jodo', but 'Goonda Jodo Yatra': BJP's Poonawalla
390.article_body: BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla accused the Congress of engaging goons across the country in the name of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. His comment comes after a video surfaced showing local Congress leaders allegedly extorting donations from a vegetable vendor in Kerala's Kollam. "This is not Congress' India Jodo Yatra, but, Goonda Jodo, Recovery Jodo, and Corruption Jodo Yatra," he said.

391.title: NGT orders Rajasthan to pay ₹3,000 cr for improper waste management
391.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has directed the Rajasthan government to pay ₹3,000 crore as compensation for improper management of solid and liquid waste. "The compensation had to be equal to the loss to the environment and the cost of remediation," said the bench. It also called for further damage to be prevented and past damage to be "restored".

392.title: Holiday for schools in Puducherry till Sept 25 as fever cases spike
392.article_body: A holiday has been declared for all schools in Puducherry and Karaikal for classes 1-8 from September 17-25 following a "sudden spike in fever cases among children", the Puducherry government announced on Friday. The decision was taken considering the well-being of the children and on the directions of the Union Territory's Chief Minister N Rangasamy and Education Minister A Namassivayam.

393.title: Malaika Arora & Amrita Arora to do a series titled 'Arora Sisters': Report
393.article_body: Malaika Arora and her actress-sister Amrita Arora are set to appear in a series titled 'Arora Sisters', according to a report. The upcoming web series will focus on the personal and professional lives of the siblings, the report said. "The show will also feature Amrita and Malaika's inner circle of folks and friends," a source quoted by Pinkvilla said.

394.title: Broadest mobilisation of secular forces needed to defeat Hindutva: CPI(M)
394.article_body: The CPI(M) said that the "broadest mobilisation of secular forces is needed to defeat Hindutva communalism". In a communique, the Polit Bureau of the CPI(M) stated, "The CPI(M) will work to develop its independent strength, strengthen Left unity, forge unity of Left & Democratic forces." It added, "BJP's claim of any role in forcing Nizam's surrender [of Hyderabad] is farcical."

395.title: Bahrain confirms first case of monkeypox in 29-year-old expatriate
395.article_body: Bahrain has reported its first confirmed case of monkeypox, the country's state news agency BNA reported on Friday citing the health ministry. The infection was detected in a 29-year-old male expatriate, as per BNA's report. Bahrain's health ministry said that the man was returning from abroad when his symptoms were suspected and diagnosed, the report added.

396.title: Maha man puts daughter's body in salt pit after alleged rape, seeks 2nd autopsy
396.article_body: The body of a woman was preserved in a salt pit for 44 days in Maharashtra's Nandurbar by her father, who alleged that she had been gang-raped and murdered, a police officer said. The man had demanded that a second post-mortem be conducted on her. According to police, three persons have been arrested in connection with the case.

397.title: He came, we saw, he conquered, we admired: Tsitsipas on Federer's retirement
397.article_body: Paying tribute to Roger Federer after he announced his retirement, world number six Stefanos Tsitsipas took to Instagram and wrote, "He came. We saw. He conquered. We admired. Thank you Roger Federer for elevating our sport to an unfathomable extent." He added, "I can't thank you enough for being the reason I pursued tennis in the first place."

398.title: Siddique Kappan is my best friend, our kids are proud of him: Wife
398.article_body: Journalist Siddique Kappan's wife on Friday stated that their children are very proud of Siddique and are "broken" seeing how he has been subjected to torture. Raihanath claimed that her daughter, who wanted to become a teacher, now wants to become an advocate to fight for her father and people like him. She also called her husband her best friend.

399.title: Will soon bring a right to health bill: Rajasthan CM
399.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Friday said that his government will soon bring a right to health bill. "I hope that soon this bill will be passed so that people get their rights," he added. Mentioning the old pension scheme and the separate budget for farmers, he claimed that his government's schemes have been "brilliant" so far.

400.title: Vinesh reveals facing period cramps at World C'ships, says 'Tried period-stopping tablets'
400.article_body: Wrestler Vinesh Phogat, who recently created history by becoming the first Indian woman to win multiple medals at World Championships, revealed she battled period cramps during the World Championships in Belgrade. "I tried period-stopping tablets for the first time, but it happened at Dubai [during transit], and I thought all...hard work of the past 10 months is gone," she said.
